item.title: Apache CloudFlare Authenticated Origin Pulls configuration
item.description: With Strict SSL enabled, CloudFlare is able to tell that my website is indeed the real one. Furthermore, I have restricted incoming IP addresses to CloudFlare ones. This should be reasonably secure but an attacker could potentially spoof its origin IP (man-in-the-middle attack) as one of theirs. To mitigate this potential problem, it is necessary for the client (CloudFlare) to present a certificate which is then verified by (my) web server.
